text: The Protectors of Heaven are soldiers personally selected by the emperor for their proven excellence and loyalty in battle. It is their loyalty and commitment to the great cause that ensures they never tire in battle, even when leading furious charges from the frontlines.

Only the very finest warriors are chosen for the honour of serving the emperor as frontline troops. Archers of exceptional talent who also show skill with the deadly jian sword are recommended to the emperor as Defenders of Earth. \\n\\n If they pass inspection, they are rewarded with uniquely-crafted jian swords and composite bows to fight on the frontline.

In defence of the emperor, these soldiers will cut back any enemy and, if need be, give their very lives. In these dark days, where the Han are embattled on many fronts, the Imperial Guards act as an imposing reminder that the emperor's word is still law.

The Protectors of Heaven are soldiers personally selected by the emperor for their proven excellence and loyalty in battle. It is their loyalty and commitment to the great cause that ensures they never tire in battle, even when leading furious charges from the frontlines.

When the three sworn brothers—Liu Bei, Guan Yu, and Zhang Fei—swore on their oath to serve the people, the fellows of the oath were among the first to follow them. They were the earliest troops to work under the command of the future leaders of the Shu regime. Much like their commanders, the Fellows of the Oath are known for their camaraderie amongst themselves.

A prolonged war turns farmers into warriors; the most oustanding among Liu Bei's milita were drafted to form the Veteran Militia Cavalry. With their superior capabilities, these troops are placed in missions that require expertise. They possess impressive mobility, and are often employed for scout and assult missions.

Originally a band of the yellow turbans in qingzhou, these troops were seized and taken under the command of Cao Cao. The Qingzhou Infantry may lack the order and discipline of other regiments, but they charge into battle with utmost passion.
Forcibly pressed into service by their local lords, these peasants would much rather return to their homes than to die in battle. They bring with them their personal tools and a fear of death.

The House of Yuan was the most influencial noble family of the late Han period. They were renowned for their wealth and influence all over China, which means they possessed the capabilities to recruit powerful troops and equip them with the highest level of weaponary. These heavy infantry units are equipped with weapon and armor of the highest qualities, and will defeat most opponents that decide to stand in their way.

These heavy infantry units are equipped with weapon and armor of the highest qualities, and will defeat most opponents that decide to stand in their way.

Only the most exceptional troops are given the honour of riding the purest of white horses; if the mounts' appearance is not enough to strike fear into their targets’ superstitious hearts, then the riders’ accuracy with their long siyah bows will surely intimidate. \\n\\n The horses are trained to ignore the din of battle, so that their riders can harass enemies with arrows or attack with zhibeidao swords, without fear that their horses will panic and bolt.

The Iron Fist Officers were the best cavalry officers under the command of Gongsun Zan. With their elite experience and expertise, the cavalry that stand in the same battlefield will be utilized in the most efficient way possible.

Xianchenying needs high maintenance costs, but he is a good fighter. They break down the opponent's battle line, especially with strong soldiers, and they are supplied with great weapons and armor. \\n\\n Xianchenying has an advantage in fighting back-to-back battles with opponents on the front line, but with some lack of maneuverability, it is necessary to place them in the right position to reduce their travel distance. \\n\\n While there is a lot of pressure to maintain well-equipped weapons and weapons, it's no better to crush and tear down enemies.

The White Feathers are among the most elite troops in Liu Bei's army. They are known for the ability to never lose control even within the most chaotic moments of battle due to their trust towards their commander. Armed with their Shuo (long spear) and a steady shield, it is no easy feat for even the most powerful generals to penetrate the White Feathers' line of defence.
